title: OKX will support the Pepper (PEPPER) airdrop for Chiliz (CHZ) holders in certain jurisdictions
body:
OKX will only support Pepper (PEPPER) airdrops for Chiliz (CHZ) holders in
certain jurisdictions. The distribution of airdrops, including PEPPER, on our
platform is not guaranteed in any or all jurisdictions.

 **PEPPER airdrop rules on OKX**

  *  _Four airdrop snapshot times_

    * First snapshot time: 12:00 am UTC on October 10, 2024.

    * Second snapshot time: 12:00 am UTC on October 17, 2024.

    * Third snapshot time: 12:00 am UTC on October 24, 2024.

    * Fourth snapshot time: 12:00 am UTC on October 31, 2024.

  *  _Rules_

    * Only OKX trading, funding, and Earn accounts with a CHZ balance of 100 or more are eligible for each airdrop. This minimum applies separately to each account.

    * Only CHZ successfully deposited into an OKX trading, funding, or Earn account as of a snapshot time will be included in the calculation. CHZ that has been withdrawn, is in the process of being withdrawn, or has not successfully been deposited at the time of a snapshot will not be included in the calculation.

    * Eligible OKX accounts will receive airdropped tokens at a ratio of 150,000 PEPPER to 1 CHZ.

    *  **Please note** that if you have any outstanding CHZ loans, including the negative equity in your trading account's multi-currency margin mode, at the time of the snapshot, you will have to repay the loan using the airdropped tokens. It is recommended that you repay your CHZ loans in advance.

  *  _Temporary suspension on depositing and withdrawing tokens_

    * OKX will temporarily suspend CHZ deposits and withdrawals on the ERC20 network 24 hours before each snapshot time. Deposits and withdrawals on the ERC20 will be resumed subsequently after the snapshot time.

    * CHZ deposits and withdrawals on the Chiliz Chain will remain accessible for all users.

  *  _Distribution timing_

    * OKX will distribute PEPPER to eligible users after OKX has received all four airdrops of PEPPER from the issuer. OKX will make an additional announcement once the distribution to eligible OKX users is completed.

 ****

 **About trading the new crypto**

At the time of this announcement, OKX **does not** support PEPPER’s spot
trading. If OKX decides to support the crypto in the future, we will issue a
separate announcement.  

Information related to the airdrop can be found at
[https://x.com/PepperChain.](https://x.com/PepperChain) OKX does not make any
representation or promise that the airdrop will occur and disclaims any
liability in the event the airdrop does not occur.  

OKX team

October 12, 2024

title: OKX to launch spot cost price feature
body:
We have introduced a new spot cost price feature to enhance your trading
experience further. This upgrade aims to help user better understand the
actual cost when trading spot on the OKX exchange. Please take note of the
following important information:

Launch date

|

August 29, 2024  
  
---|---  
  
Affected pages

|

1\. Trade page

2\. Candlestick chart

3\. Assets > Token details  
  
Key changes

|

\- A new spot cost price feature has been introduced to provide users with a
clear understanding of actual costs when they are engaged in spot trading.

\- Two algorithm options, average cost price and cumulative cost price, have
been introduced to suit different trading preferences.  
  
Important notes

|

\- The spot cost price will begin from the launch date, excluding assets held
prior and not yet sold.

\- A feature for adjusting cost prices, allowing the inclusion of previously
excluded amounts in calculations, will be introduced in the future.  
  
We appreciate your continued support and look forward to enhancing your
trading experience with this new feature.

  
OKX team

title: OKX to adjust weightings of components for several indexes
body:
To improve market liquidity and index stability, OKX will adjust the
components and their weights of several indexes at **8:00 am - 10:00 am UTC on
September 1, 2024**. The adjusted index prices will be calculated by weighting
the prices of the new components according to their updated weights.

Component adjustment details are as follows:

Index | Before | After  
---|---|---  
Exchange | Pair | Weight | Exchange | Pair | Weight  
XRP-USD | Kraken | XRP/USD | 23.07% | Kraken | XRP/USD | 17.64%  
Binance | XRP/BTC | 30.76% | OKX | XRP/USDT | 23.53%  
OKX | XRP/BTC | 30.76% | Binance | XRP/USDT | 23.53%  
Bitstamp | XRP/USD | 15.38% | Crypto | XRP/USD | 17.64%  
|  |  | Coinbase | XRP/USD | 17.64%  
  
**Index Price Computation**

The index price is calculated by weighting the prices of components based on
their respective weights. For more details, please refer to [Spot index
prices](/en-eu/help/i-spot-index-prices).

 **Component adjustments can cause an index’s mark price to fluctuate,
affecting the corresponding instrument’s margin and contract trading
markets.**

 **Users are advised to take necessary measures before an adjustment, such as
reducing positions, adding margin, lowering leverage or even closing positions
to avoid potential risks introduced by market volatility.**

title: OKX to change discount rate rules in multi-currency and portfolio margin modes
body:
To ensure platform safety and improve precision in risk measurement and
trading rules implementation, OKX will adjust the discount rates for all
traders in multi-currency margin mode and portfolio margin mode.

The adjustment will take place from **8:00 am UTC on August 22, 2024 to 8:00
am UTC on September 22, 2024**. After the adjustment, the discount tiers will
be based on crypto amounts, with each crypto assigned to its own tiers.

The specific adjustments are as follows:

## Discount rule changes

The new discount tiers will be based on crypto amounts, with each crypto
assigned to its own tiers, as shown below:

Web:

App:

## Discount rates of each crypto

The following table shows the discount rates for the first crypto tier and the
decrement for each subsequent tier:

|

|

---|---|---

XRP

Note: Any newly listed crypto will be updated to this table.

For more details on the new discount tiers and rates, refer to the following
Excel file: [Discount rate
v1](//www.okx.com/cdn/assets/plugins/announcements/contentful/tofttmniq0qv/4HwrRvtl8lYDIoTnGNRRO3/ab3ef9125ceb994b1d5e77fb40577ad1/discounts_v1.csv)

API users can begin querying the new discount rates on the [Get discount rate
and interest free quota](/docs-v5/en#public-data-rest-api-get-discount-rate-
and-interest-free-quota) page from **8:00 am UTC on August 15, 2024**.

## Affected calculations

 **Adjusted equity before the changes**

|

 **Adjusted equity after the changes**  
  
---|---  
  
 **Discount rates for BTC with tiers valued in USD**

Tier and discount rate

0 - 5,000,000 USD: 1

5,000,000 - 10,000,000 USD: 0.975

Assume the price of BTC is 60,000 USD and you have 100 BTC.

Equity = 100 BTC

Equity = 100 × 60,000 = 6,000,000 USD

Adjusted equity = 5,000,000 × 1 + 1,000,000 × 0.975 = 5,975,000 USD

|

 **Discount rates for BTC with tiers valued in crypto**

Tier and discount rate

0 - 20 BTC: 0.98

20 - 25 BTC: 0.975

25 - 30 BTC: 0.97

30 - 50 BTC: 0.965

50 - 70 BTC: 0.96

70 - 90 BTC: 0.955

90 - 110 BTC: 0.95

Assume the price of BTC is 60,000 USD and you have 100 BTC.

Equity = 100 BTC

Equity = 100 × 60,000 = 6,000,000 USD

Adjusted equity = (20 × 0.98 + 5 × 0.975 + 5 × 0.97 + 20 × 0.965 + 20 × 0.96 +
20 × 0.955 + 10 × 0.95) × 60,000 = 5,785,500 USD  
  
## Liquidation rules

 **Before the changes**

|

 **After the changes**  
  
---|---  
  
The asset liquidation sequence starts with less liquid crypto.

The liability liquidation sequence starts with crypto that’s more likely to
increase your margin level to 110%.

Liquidation penalties for both crypto and liabilities are based on position
tiers.

|

The asset liquidation sequence starts with more liquid crypto.

The liability liquidation sequence starts with more liquid crypto.

Liquidation penalties for assets are based on the liquidation penalty rates of
the corresponding discount tiers.

Liquidation penalties for liabilities are based on the corresponding position
tiers.  
  
## Application of the new discount rate rules

We’ll progressively apply the new discount rate rules to all traders from
**8:00 am UTC on August 22, 2024 to 8:00 am UTC on September 22, 2024**.
Changes that apply to main accounts also apply to the corresponding sub-
accounts.

Before the discount rate changes go live, you can test them in demo trading
from 8:00 am UTC on August 1, 2024.

 **Risk warning:** The changes to the discount rate rules will affect the risk
levels of your account. Manage these risks accordingly.

## How to check if the new discount rate rules have taken effect

On the website, go to the following [page](/en-eu/trade-market/discountrate).

On the app, go to Market info and select Discount rates.

If you’re an API user, query /api/v5/account/config.

discountType will return 1 if the new tiers and calculations have taken
effect.

For more details on API changes, go to the [change
log](/docs-v5/log_en#upcoming-changes-okx-to-change-discount-rate-rules-in-
multi-currency-and-portfolio-margin-modes).

OKX team  
July 25, 2024

title: OKX to adjust funding rate interval for certain perpetual futures
body:
In order to mitigate risks and improve your trading experience, OKX will
adjust the funding rate interval for certain perpetual futures **on July 18,
2024, and July 25, 2024.**

Specific adjustment details are as follows:

 **July 18, 2024:**

Futures | Funding rate interval before adjustment | Funding rate interval
after adjustment | Adjustment time(UTC)  
---|---|---|---  
TRBUSDT perpetual | Every 8 hours | Every 4 hours | 8:00 am  
  
**July 25, 2024:**

Futures | Funding rate interval before adjustment | Funding rate interval
after adjustment | Adjustment time(UTC)  
---|---|---|---  
AUCTIONUSDT perpetual | Every 8 hours | Every 4 hours | 8:00 am  
GASUSDT perpetual | Every 8 hours | Every 4 hours | 8:00 am  
MINAUSDT perpetual | Every 8 hours | Every 4 hours | 8:00 am  
ORBSUSDT perpetual | Every 8 hours | Every 4 hours | 8:00 am  
  
The original funding rate interval for these perpetual futures is 8 hours. The
platform settles funding fees at 12:00 am, 8:00 am, and 4:00 pm each day.

Post adjustment, the funding rate interval for these contracts will be 4
hours. The platform will settle funding fees at 12:00 am, 4:00 am, 8:00 am,
12:00 pm, 4:00 pm, 8:00 pm each day.

For example, for the TRBUSDT perpetual contract, the funding fee settlement
schedule before and after the adjustment is as follows:

Funding rate interval | Date | Funding fee settlement time(UTC)  
---|---|---  
Every 8 hours | July 18, 2024 | 12:00 am  
Adjusted from every 8 hours to every 4 hours | July 18, 2024 | 8:00 am  
Every 4 hours | July 18, 2024 | 12:00 pm  
Every 4 hours | July 18, 2024 | 4:00 pm  
Every 4 hours | July 18, 2024 | 8:00 pm  
Every 4 hours | July 19, 2024 | 12:00 am  
Every 4 hours | July 19, 2024 | 4:00 am  
Every 4 hours | July 19, 2024 | 8:00 am  
Every 4 hours | July 19, 2024 | 12:00 pm  
Every 4 hours | July 19, 2024 | 4:00 pm  
Every 4 hours | July 19, 2024 | 8:00 pm  
  
Learn more: [https://www.okx.com/trade-market/funding/swap](/en-eu/trade-
market/funding/swap)

 **Risk disclaimer**

As the market is highly volatile, rules adjustments may potentially lead to
forced liquidation, users are encouraged to decrease leverage by either
increasing margins or closing positions.

For any inquiries regarding this adjustment, please feel free to contact us
via the [OKX Telegram](https://t.me/OKExOfficial_English) group or the
[Support Center](/en-eu/help;;okex:/supportcenter).  

OKX team

July 12, 2024

title: OKX to adjust discount rates for BETH
body:
OKX will adjust the discount rates for BETH in the multi-currency margin mode
and portfolio margin mode. The adjustment will take place at **6:00 am – 8:00
am (UTC) on July 18, 2024**. After the adjustment, the discount rate for BETH
will be higher. Please note that this change will not affect the risk level of
your current positions.  

Specific adjustments are as follows:

Asset | Before | After  
---|---|---  
Tier (USD) | Discount rate | Tier (USD) | Discount rate  
BETH | 0 ~ 1,000,000 | 0.8 | 0 ~ 2,000,000 | 0.95  
1,000,000 ~ 2,000,000 | 0.75 | 2,000,000 ~ 4,000,000 | 0.85  
2,000,000 ~ 4,000,000 | 0.5 | 4,000,000 ~ 8,000,000 | 0.5  
> 4,000,000 | 0 | > 8,000,000 | 0  
  
**Introduction to discount rates**

In multi-currency cross margin mode and portfolio margin mode, different
currencies in cross margin accounts can be converted into their USD value and
used as margin. Due to significant differences in market liquidity of each
currency, the platform calculates their actual USD value based on a certain
discount rate in order to balance market risks.

Learn more: [Discount rate](/en-eu/trade-market/discountrate)

title: VIP Loan Upgrade
body:
To improve user experience, OKX will enhance VIP Loan for traders at the VIP 5
tier and above at 12:00 am UTC on June 6, 2024. The initial supported
currencies are USDT, USDC, BTC, and ETH.

 **Enhanced VIP Loan**

The enhanced VIP Loan works on a market model, matching borrowing orders
(taker orders) to lending orders (maker orders). Lenders place orders on the
Simple Earn order book, specifying an amount and interest rate. Borrowers
place orders based on an interest rate, and choose their loan amounts.
Borrowing orders are matched to lending orders based on the borrower’s
interest rate. Once a borrowing order matches one or more lending orders, the
weighted average interest rate for the lending orders becomes the interest
rate for the borrowing order.

After you create a borrowing order, you can choose to repay or roll over your
loan at maturity. The enhanced VIP Loan helps you to borrow with increased
predictability, stability, and flexibility.

 **To place a VIP Loan order, follow these steps:**

  1. Go to the Trade page on the Exchange and choose **VIP Loan**. 

  2. Choose the crypto you want to borrow.

  3. Enter your expected maximum interest rate on the order placement page. You can check the current marketing interest rate on the **Market overview** page.

  4. After entering an expected maximum interest rate, the estimated amount available for borrowing is displayed. Note that this amount is for reference only, and then adjust the amount you want to borrow.

  5. Make sure the available balance in your trading account can cover the interest, as this will be deducted from your account immediately upon the borrowing order successfully being initiated.

  6. Finally, you can enable the Auto-rollover feature and set your maximum expected rollover interest rate.

Remember to repay loans from the previous VIP Loan by June 30, 2024. These
loans are also displayed on the enhanced VIP Loan under the **Loan overview**
tab.

For detailed product documentation on the enhanced VIP Loan, please click
[here](/en-eu/help/viii-vip-loan).

This content is provided for informational purposes only. It is not intended
to provide (i) investment advice or an investment recommendation; (ii) an
offer or solicitation to buy, sell, or hold digital assets, or (iii)
financial, accounting, legal, or tax advice. Digital asset holdings, including
stablecoins and NFTs, involve a high degree of risk, can fluctuate greatly,
and can even become worthless. You should carefully consider whether trading
or holding digital assets is suitable for you in light of your financial
condition. Please consult your legal/tax/investment professional for questions
about your specific circumstances. Information (including market data and
statistical information, if any) appearing in this post is for general
information purposes only. While all reasonable care has been taken in
preparing this data and graphs, no responsibility or liability is accepted for
any errors of fact or omission expressed herein. Both OKX Web3 Wallet and OKX
NFT Marketplace are subject to separate terms of service at [www.okx.com](/en-
eu).

OKX team,

June 6, 2024

title: OKX to adjust the minimum order quantities for several futures
body:
To continually improve the trading experience and reduce costs for our
traders, OKX will adjust the minimum order quantities for some perpetual and
expiry futures. This update is scheduled for **6:00 am - 8:00 am UTC on June
6, 2024.** Corresponding adjustments to step size will also be implemented.

The specific adjustments are as follows:

Instrument | Trading pair | Minimum order quantity, step size (contracts)
(Before) | Minimum order quantity, step size (coins) (Before) | Minimum order
quantity, step size (contracts) (After) | Minimum order quantity, step size
(coins) (After)  
---|---|---|---|---|---  
Perpetual | FET/USDT | 1 | 10 | 0.1 | 1  
Perpetual | SOL/USDT | 0.1 | 0.1 | 0.01 | 0.01  
Perpetual | STX/USDT | 1 | 10 | 0.1 | 1  
Perpetual | THETA/USDT | 1 | 10 | 0.1 | 1  
  
For more information, please visit the OKX website: [_**Trad**_](/en-eu/trade-
market/info/spot)[ _ **ing rules**_](/en-eu/trade-market/info/swap)  

Please note: All trading activities, including order placement, fund
transfers, and leverage adjustments, will remain unaffected during the
adjustment period for step size and minimum order quantity.

 **1\. Understanding step size and minimum order quantity**

Step size is defined as the smallest possible increment or decrement in the
number of contracts placed for perpetual and expiry futures.

For instance, in the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract size of 0.1
ETH, the updated step size is set at 0.1 contracts. This means the minimum
fluctuation in the contracts ordered is 0.1 contracts (equivalent to 0.01
ETH).

Minimum order quantity is the smallest number of contracts permissible for an
order in perpetual and expiry futures. It must be an integer multiple of the
step size. Traders must place orders equal to or larger than this minimum
order quantity.

For instance, in the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract size of 0.1 ETH
and a step size of 0.1 contracts, the minimum order quantity is set at 1
contract (0.1 ETH). This implies that order quantities must be greater than or
equal to 1 contract (0.1 ETH), but can be increased in increments based on
step size, such as 1.1 contracts, 1.2 contracts, and so on.

2\. **Display rules for open positions and open orders**

Upon adjusting the step size, if the new step size is less than 1, both
position contract sizes and order quantities will be displayed in decimals.
This applies to unfulfilled, partially filled, completely filled, and open
orders, as well as the sizes of open positions.

For instance, the SHIBUSDT perpetual futures has a contract size of 1,000,000
SHIB. Currently, the step size is set at 1 contract, order quantity of 10
contracts (10,000,000 SHIB) and a position size of 1 contract (1,000,000
SHIB). After adjusting the step size to 0.1 contracts, the order quantity will
be displayed as 10.5 contracts (10,500,000 SHIB) and the position size as 1.5
contracts (1,500,000 SHIB).  
(This adjustment is applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)

3\. **Order processing rules**

For new orders, traders must ensure that the quantity placed or modified is an
integral multiple of the step size and at least equal to the minimum order
quantity.

Take the SHIBUSDT perpetual contract as an example: with a contract size of
1,000,000 SHIB, both the current step size and the minimum order quantity are
set at 1 contract. This means that when placing or modifying orders, the
quantities must be in integral multiples of 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB), with
the smallest permissible order being 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB).

When the step size is adjusted to 0.1 contracts, any order placed or modified
must be in integral multiples of 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB); and after
adjusting the minimum order quantity to 0.1 contracts, the order size must be
greater than or equal to 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB).  
(These rules are also applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)

4\. **API interface adjustment rules**

Post-adjustment, the API endpoint (/api/v5/public/instruments) and the
WebSocket channel (Instruments) will reflect the updated values for step size
(lotSz) and minimum order quantity (minSz).

More details: [https://www.okx.com/docs-v5/log_en/#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts](/docs-v5/log_en#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts)

title: OKX to enhance new features in portfolio margin mode
body:
To further enhance the experience of traders, OKX plans to update spot-
derivatives risk offset mode within portfolio margin mode at 4:00 am UTC on
June 5, 2024.

The specific updates are as follows:

  1.  **Richer offset structure types** : Incorporate **spot orders** into the derivatives offset system (distinct from spot assets). Adding offset structures for spot and derivatives orders (Offsetting orders in the Liquid Marketplace can significantly reduce the margin in use).

  2.  **More flexible spot offset quantity adjustments** : Allow users to customize the number of spot assets included in the derivatives offset structure.

  3.  **More accurate numerical calculations** : Conduct more accurate measurements for spot assets within the derivatives margin system and adjust the handling of spot assets during liquidations.

    1.  **MMR calculation** : Includes the measurement of basis risk between spot assets/orders and derivatives positions/orders (MR4).  
 **Note: This may increase the maintenance margin, for example, in
combinations where spot assets are offset with perpetual, expiry futures, or
options.**

Positions/Orders structure | Before | After  
---|---|---  
Open positions:  
BTC spot: 10 BTC  
BTCUSDT perpetual: -1,000 contracts  
  
Orders:  
BTC/USDT spot buy orders: Buy 5 BTC at a mark price | MR1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 = 0
USDT  
MR7 = 3,020.87 USDT  
  
  
MMR = Max [Max (MR1, MR2, MR6) + MR3 + MR4 + MR5, MR7)] = 3,020.87 USDT | MR1,
2, 3, 5, 6 = 0 USDT  
MR4 = 8,053.32 USDT  
MR7 = 3,020.17 USDT  
  
MMR = Max [Max (MR1, MR2, MR6) + MR3 + MR4 + MR5, MR7)] = 8,053.32 USDT  
  
    2. **Liquidation engine** : Enhances the liquidation structure by incorporating a basis risk offsetting process between spot and derivatives positions.

  4.  **More diverse offsetting modes** : Expand the spot offsetting function to all margin modes, including USDT/USDC/Crypto modes, supporting offsetting between spot assets and their corresponding USDC-margined risk units.

The table below illustrates the range of offsetting instruments for various
modes:

Offset mode | ETH-USDT risk unit | ETH-USDC risk unit | ETH-USD risk unit  
---|---|---|---  
Derivatives  
| ETHUSDT perpetual/expiry  
(positions and orders)  
| ETHUSDC perpetual/expiry  
(positions and orders) | ETHUSD perpetual/expiry/options  
(positions and orders)  
Spot-derivatives (USDT)  
| ETHUSDT perpetual/expiry, ETH spot assets, ETH/USDT and ETH/USDC spot orders
| ETHUSDC perpetual/expiry  
(positions and orders) | ETHUSD perpetual/expiry/options  
(positions and orders)  
Spot-derivatives (USDC)  
| ETHUSDT perpetual/expiry  
(positions and orders) | ETHUSDC perpetual/expiry (positions and orders), ETH
spot assets, ETH/USDT and ETH/USDC spot orders | ETHUSDT perpetual/expiry  
(positions and orders)  
Spot-derivatives (crypto) | ETHUSDT perpetual/expiry  
(positions and orders) | ETHUSDC perpetual/expiry  
(positions and orders) | ETHUSD perpetual/expiry/options (positions and
orders), ETH spot assets, ETH/USDT and ETH/USDC spot orders  
  
* Derivatives (Expiry/Perpetual/Options) structures include both positions and orders.

* Spot-derivatives risk offsetting USDT/USDC/Crypto mode: With this mode, spot assets and spot (USDT/USDC pairs) orders can be offset using corresponding USDT/USDC/Crypto as the margin risk unit.  

Details on the spot-derivatives risk offset updates and maintenance margin
rules can be found on the [Portfolio margin mode: cross margin trading](/en-
eu/help/v-portfolio-margin-mode-cross-margin-trading) page.

Changes to the API rules can be found on the [Set spot risk offset amount –
OKX API guide | OKX technical support | OKX](/docs-v5/log_en#upcoming-changes-
support-customizing-spot-risk-offset-amount-set-spot-risk-offset-amount) page.  

OKX team

May 31, 2024

title: OKX to adjust parameters in portfolio margin mode
body:
To enhance capital efficiency for basis trading in portfolio margin mode, we
will adjust **the MR4 (basis risk factor) parameters** at 8:00 am UTC on May
11, 2024. The specific changes are as follows:

 **Underlying currency**

|

 **Before: maximum forward basis move**

|

 **After: maximum forward basis move**  
  
---|---|---  
  
BTC and ETH

|

30%

|

 **10%**  
  
MR4 is an evaluation of price fluctuations in expiry futures with the same
underlying asset but different expiration dates. Note that expiry futures with
later expiration dates may have higher volatility.

  
For details on MMR rules in portfolio margin mode, refer to [Ⅴ. Portfolio
Margin mode: cross margin trading](/en-eu/help/v-portfolio-margin-mode-cross-
margin-trading).

  
OKX team

May 10, 2024

**Risk warning**

During the tick size adjustment period, **trading will be temporarily
suspended for 2 minutes for the trading pair adjusted to a smaller decimal
value** , you will not be able to transfer funds, place orders, amend orders,
and cancel orders for the affected trading pair. **Other trading pairs will
not be affected.** Trading for the trading pair adjusted to a larger decimal
value will not be affected.  

 **How orders and position are handled regarding the tick size adjustment**

 **1) For existing orders**

  1. If the tick size is adjusted to a smaller decimal value (0.0001 to 0.01)

    1. Limit orders: If your existing order has a larger decimal place than the adjusted tick size, your existing order will be canceled. If your existing order has a smaller or equal decimal place than the adjusted tick size, your existing order will not be canceled. For example, if tick size is adjusted from 0.0001 to 0.01, Existing Order 130.2442 will be canceled and Existing Order 130.24 will not be canceled.

    2. Trading bots: If your existing order has a larger decimal place than the adjusted tick size, your existing order will be canceled. If your existing order has a smaller or equal decimal place than the adjusted tick size, your existing order will not be canceled. For example, if the tick size is adjusted from 0.0001 to 0.01, limit order 130.2442 will be canceled and limit order 130.24 will not be canceled.

      1. For grid and DCA bots, any open orders you already placed with a trading bot will be canceled first (including spot grid, futures grid, moon grid, infinity grid, spot DCA, futures DCA), then the bots will be stopped.

      2. For all other bots and order types (including singal Bot, recurring buy, TWAP, iceberg, smart portfolio, arbitrage, stop, trailing stop, trigger), your open orders will be canceled first, but the bots will not be affected. Your bots will resume trading with the new tick size after trading resumes.

  2. If the tick size is adjusted to a larger decimal value (0.01 to 0.0001)

    1. After the adjustment, existing orders, will be filled according to the adjusted tick size.

 **Note: The above rules are also applicable to orders placed using API.**

  
After the tick size is adjusted (for example, from 0.0001 to 0.01), if you
place an order with the previous tick size (0.0001) via API, the system will
automatically round down buy orders and round up sell orders so that the order
can be successfully placed. However, you will not be able to place orders
using the pre-adjusted tick size on the normal web and mobile interface.

  
 **2) Open orders and the display of historical orders**

  1. If the tick size is adjusted to smaller decimal places (0.0001 to 0.01): For non-API users, open orders and historical orders will be displayed with the adjusted tick size by rounding down the buy orders and rounding up the sell orders. For API users, open orders and historical orders will be displayed as the pre-adjustment tick size.

  2. If the tick size is adjusted to larger decimal places (0.01 to 0.0001): Open orders and historical orders will be displayed with the original tick size.

  
You are encouraged to adjust your trading strategies based on the above
changes.  

 **Risk warning:** The foregoing overview and information, some of which may
be provided by third parties and not OKX, are for informational and
educational purposes only. OKX does not guarantee the accuracy or completeness
of any information contained herein and such information does not constitute

title: OKX will stop supporting Quick margin and Manual transfers modes in isolated margin and futures trading
body:
**OKX will stop supporting Quick margin and Manual transfers modes in isolated
margin and futures trading**

To maintain trading stability, OKX will discontinue **Quick margin** mode in
isolated margin trading, and **Manual transfers** mode in both isolated margin
and futures trading. The update is scheduled for 8:00 am UTC on 29 May, 2024.

If you have any open orders or positions using **Quick margin** mode **** in
**** isolated margin trading, or **Manual transfers** mode in either isolated
margin or futures trading, we strongly recommend that you cancel such orders
and close out such positions to avoid incurring any losses once the trading
modes have been discontinued. Once you have closed out your positions and
cancelled your orders, the system will automatically switch to **Auto
transfers** mode in isolated margin and futures trading.  

 **Important notes:**

  * The update will not affect users that are currently using **Auto transfers** mode in isolated margin or futures trading. Frontend users that are unable to see the toggle between modes on the settings page are not affected as well.

  * Below are screenshots of the order page when in **Auto transfers** mode and the trade settings page.

 **Trade settings**

 **Auto transfers mode in isolated margin trading**

 **Auto transfers mode in isolated futures trading**

  * API users will encounter an error code “59006” when attempting to switch to **Quick margin** mode in isolated margin trading, or **Manual transfers** mode in isolated margin and futures trading. The error code message will return “This feature is unavailable and will go offline soon.” To check if you are in **Auto transfers** mode, please refer to

[ **Account configuration**](/docs-v5/en#trading-account-rest-api-get-account-
configuration).

  
Thank you for your support and understanding. For any inquiries, please feel
free to contact us via the [_**support center**_](/en-eu/help) or [_**connect
with us**_](/en-eu/community) on any platform of your choice.  

OKX team

April 12, 2024

title: OKX to adjust the minimum order quantities for several futures
body:
To continually improve the trading experience and reduce costs for our
traders, OKX will adjust the minimum order quantities for some perpetual and
expiry futures. This update is scheduled for **6:00 am - 8:00 am UTC on April
18, 2024.** Corresponding adjustments to step size will also be implemented.

The specific adjustments are as follows:

Instrument | Trading pair | Minimum order quantity, step size (contracts)
(Before) | Minimum order quantity, step size (contracts) (After)  
---|---|---|---  
Perpetual | ETH/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Expiry | ETH/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
  
For more information, please visit the OKX website: [_**Trad**_](/en-eu/trade-
market/info/spot)[ _ **ing rules**_](/en-eu/trade-market/info/swap)

  
Please note: All trading activities, including order placement, fund
transfers, and leverage adjustments, will remain unaffected during the
adjustment period for step size and minimum order quantity.

  
 **1\. Understanding step size and minimum order quantity**

Step size is defined as the smallest possible increment or decrement in the
number of contracts placed for perpetual and expiry futures.  
For instance, in the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract size of 0.1
ETH, the updated step size is set at 0.1 contracts. This means the minimum
fluctuation in the contracts ordered is 0.1 contracts (equivalent to 0.01
ETH).

Minimum order quantity is the smallest number of contracts permissible for an
order in perpetual and expiry futures. It must be an integer multiple of the
step size. Traders must place orders equal to or larger than this minimum
order quantity.

For instance, in the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract size of 0.1 ETH
and a step size of 0.1 contracts, the minimum order quantity is set at 1
contract (0.1 ETH). This implies that order quantities must be greater than or
equal to 1 contract (0.1 ETH), but can be increased in increments based on
step size, such as 1.1 contracts, 1.2 contracts, and so on.  

 **2\. Display rules for open positions and open orders**

Upon adjusting the step size, if the new step size is less than 1, both
position contract sizes and order quantities will be displayed in decimals.
This applies to unfulfilled, partially filled, completely filled, and open
orders, as well as the sizes of open positions.

For instance, the SHIBUSDT perpetual futures has a contract size of 1,000,000
SHIB. Currently, the step size is set at 1 contract, order quantity of 10
contracts (10,000,000 SHIB) and a position size of 1 contract (1,000,000
SHIB). After adjusting the step size to 0.1 contracts, the order quantity will
be displayed as 10.5 contracts (10,500,000 SHIB) and the position size as 1.5
contracts (1,500,000 SHIB).  
(This adjustment is applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)  

 **3\. Order processing rules**

For new orders, traders must ensure that the quantity placed or modified is an
integral multiple of the step size and at least equal to the minimum order
quantity.

Take the SHIBUSDT perpetual contract as an example: with a contract size of
1,000,000 SHIB, both the current step size and the minimum order quantity are
set at 1 contract. This means that when placing or modifying orders, the
quantities must be in integral multiples of 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB), with
the smallest permissible order being 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB).

When the step size is adjusted to 0.1 contracts, any order placed or modified
must be in integral multiples of 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB); and after
adjusting the minimum order quantity to 0.1 contracts, the order size must be
greater than or equal to 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB).  
(These rules are also applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)  

 **4\. API interface adjustment rules**

Post-adjustment, the API endpoint (/api/v5/public/instruments) and the
WebSocket channel (Instruments) will reflect the updated values for step size
(lotSz) and minimum order quantity (minSz).

More details: [https://www.okx.com/docs-v5/log_en/#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts](/docs-v5/log_en#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts)

title: OKX to adjust the minimum order quantities for several futures
body:
To continually improve the trading experience and reduce costs for our
traders, OKX will adjust the minimum order quantities for some perpetual and
expiry futures. This update is scheduled for **8:00 am - 10:00 am UTC on March
28, 2024.** Corresponding adjustments to step size will also be implemented.

The specific adjustments are as follows:

Instrument | Trading pair | Minimum order quantity, step size (contracts)
(Before) | Minimum order quantity, step size (contracts) (After)  
---|---|---|---  
Perpetual | ADA/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | ARB/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | AVAX/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | BCH/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | BSV/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | DOGE/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | ETC/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Expiry | ETC/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | MKR/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | NEAR/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | PEPE/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | SOL/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | TRX/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | XRP/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
Expiry | XRP/USDT | 1 | 0.1  
  
For more information, please visit the OKX website: [_**Trad**_](/en-eu/trade-
market/info/spot)[ _ **ing rules**_](/en-eu/trade-market/info/swap)

Please note: All trading activities, including order placement, fund
transfers, and leverage adjustments, will remain unaffected during the
adjustment period for step size and minimum order quantity.

 ****

 **1\. Understanding step size and minimum order quantity**

Step size is defined as the smallest possible increment or decrement in the
number of contracts placed for perpetual and expiry futures. For instance, in
the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract size of 0.1 ETH, the updated
step size is set at 0.1 contracts. This means the minimum fluctuation in the
contracts ordered is 0.1 contracts (equivalent to 0.01 ETH).

Minimum order quantity is the smallest number of contracts permissible for an
order in perpetual and expiry futures. It must be an integer multiple of the
step size. Traders must place orders equal to or larger than this minimum
order quantity. For instance, in the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract
size of 0.1 ETH and a step size of 0.1 contracts, the minimum order quantity
is set at 1 contract (0.1 ETH). This implies that order quantities must be
greater than or equal to 1 contract (0.1 ETH), but can be increased in
increments based on step size, such as 1.1 contracts, 1.2 contracts, and so
on.

 **2\. Display rules for open positions and open orders**

Upon adjusting the step size, if the new step size is less than 1, both
position contract sizes and order quantities will be displayed in decimals.
This applies to unfulfilled, partially filled, completely filled, and open
orders, as well as the sizes of open positions.

For instance, the SHIBUSDT perpetual futures has a contract size of 1,000,000
SHIB. Currently, the step size is set at 1 contract, order quantity of 10
contracts (10,000,000 SHIB) and a position size of 1 contract (1,000,000
SHIB). After adjusting the step size to 0.1 contracts, the order quantity will
be displayed as 10.5 contracts (10,500,000 SHIB) and the position size as 1.5
contracts (1,500,000 SHIB).

(This adjustment is applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)

 **3\. Order processing rules**

For new orders, traders must ensure that the quantity placed or modified is an
integral multiple of the step size and at least equal to the minimum order
quantity.

Take the SHIBUSDT perpetual contract as an example: with a contract size of
1,000,000 SHIB, both the current step size and the minimum order quantity are
set at 1 contract. This means that when placing or modifying orders, the
quantities must be in integral multiples of 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB), with
the smallest permissible order being 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB).

When the step size is adjusted to 0.1 contracts, any order placed or modified
must be in integral multiples of 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB); and after
adjusting the minimum order quantity to 0.1 contracts, the order size must be
greater than or equal to 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB).

(These rules are also applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)

 **4\. API interface adjustment rules**

Post-adjustment, the API endpoint (/api/v5/public/instruments) and the
WebSocket channel (Instruments) will reflect the updated values for step size
(lotSz) and minimum order quantity (minSz).

More details: [https://www.okx.com/docs-v5/log_en/#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts](/docs-v5/log_en#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts)

title: OKX to adjust tick size of spot and margin
body:
In order to increase market liquidity and improve your trading experience, OKX
will adjust the tick sizes of certain spot/margin at **6:00 am - 8:00 am UTC
on March 12, 2024**.

Specific adjustment details are as follows:

Note: If the trading pair is available for spot and margin markets, the
adjustment will apply to both.

Instruments

|

Trading pairs

|

Tick size (before)

|

Tick size (after)  
  
---|---|---|---  
  
Spot

|

LHINU/USDT

|

0.0000001

|

0.00000001  
  
Spot

|

LON/USDT

|

0.001

|

0.0001  
  
Spot

|

WXT/USDT

|

0.00001

|

0.000001  
  
 **Risk warning**

During the tick size adjustment period, **trading for the pairs adjusted to
fewer decimal places (e.g., from 0.0001 to 0.01)** will be temporarily
suspended for 2 minutes **.** During this suspension, you will not be able to
transfer funds, place, adjust, or cancel orders for the affected pairs. **This
suspension does not apply to other trading pairs.** Trading for pairs adjusted
to more decimal places will not be affected (e.g., from 0.01 to 0.0001).

  
 **How orders and position are handled regarding the tick size adjustment**

 **1) For open orders**

  1. If the tick size is adjusted to fewer decimal places (e.g., from 0.0001 to 0.01)

    1. Limit orders: If your open order has more decimal places than the adjusted tick size, your open order will be canceled. If your open order has fewer or equal decimal places than the adjusted tick size, your pending order will not be canceled. For example, if tick size is adjusted from 0.0001 to 0.01, open order 130.2442 will be canceled and open order 130.24 will not be canceled.

    2. Trading bots: If your open order has more decimal places than the adjusted tick size, your open order will be canceled. If your open order has fewer or equal decimal places than the adjusted tick size, your open order will not be canceled. For example, if the tick size is adjusted from 0.0001 to 0.01, limit order 130.2442 will be canceled and limit order 130.24 will not be canceled.

      1. For grid and DCA bots, any open orders you have already placed with a trading bot will be canceled first (including spot grid, futures grid, moon grid, infinity grid, spot DCA, and futures DCA), then the bots will be stopped.

      2. For all other bots and order types (including signal bot, recurring buy, TWAP, iceberg, smart portfolio, arbitrage, stop, trailing stop, and trigger), your open orders will be canceled first, but the bots will not be affected. Your bots will resume trading with the new tick size after trading resumes.

  2. If the tick size is adjusted to more decimal places (e.g., from 0.01 to 0.0001)

    1. After the adjustment, open orders will be filled according to the adjusted tick size.

 **Note: The above rules are also applicable to orders placed using API.**

  
After the tick size is adjusted (e.g., from 0.0001 to 0.01), if you place an
order with the previous tick size (0.0001) via API, the system will
automatically round down buy orders and round up sell orders so that the order
can be successfully placed. However, you will not be able to place orders
using the pre-adjusted tick size on the normal web and mobile interface.

  
 **2) Open orders and the display of historical orders**

  1. If the tick size is adjusted to fewer decimal places (e.g., from 0.0001 to 0.01): For non-API users, open orders and historical orders will be displayed with the adjusted tick size by rounding down the buy orders and rounding up the sell orders. For API users, open orders and historical orders will be displayed as the pre-adjustment tick size.

  2. If the tick size is adjusted to more decimal places (e.g., from 0.01 to 0.0001): Open orders and historical orders will be displayed with the original tick size.

  
You are encouraged to adjust your trading strategies based on the above
changes.

title: OKX to implement mandatory Self-Trade Prevention
body:
Self-Trade Prevention (STP) aims to curb accidental self-trades, minimizing
unnecessary trading fees and ensuring a compliant and fair trading
environment.

In June 2023, OKX introduced STP as an optional feature for API users.

From **10 am UTC on March 14, 2024** , OKX will mandate STP on a master
account basis for all new orders across all trading symbols and business
lines. This will prohibit trades **between the same master account, between
sub-accounts under the same master account, and between the same master
account and its affiliated sub-accounts**. For example, if master account A
has 2 sub-accounts, A1 and A2, trades between the following accounts will be
prohibited:

  * A with A
  * A1 with A1
  * A2 with A2
  * A with A1
  * A with A2
  * A1 with A2

**Key reminders:**

  * The default STP mode will cancel maker orders. If a taker order leads to self-trading, the maker order on the order book will be canceled, while the taker order will match with subsequent orders.
  * API users can select alternative STP modes by using the `stpMode` parameter with their new orders via the API endpoints for certain order types. Refer to the API documentation for details.
  * Self-trades may still occur between orders created before and after mandatory STP implementation.
  * For block trading, the maker will not receive the RFQ if the taker is under the same master account.
  * You can find orders canceled due to STP by going to Order history on the OKX website or app. API users can query Order history REST endpoints or subscribe to the Orders WebSocket channel for this information.

**Further references:**

  * [Introducing Self-Trade Prevention: Better trading efficiency and protection for API users](/en-eu/help/how-do-i-prevent-self-trade-and-improve-my-api-trading-efficiency-and)
  * [Mandatory STP - API upcoming changes](/docs-v5/log_en#upcoming-changes-enabling-self-trade-prevention-by-default)

OKX team

title: OKX to postpone adjusting discount rates for BETH
body:
Due to increased market volatility, [the discount rates adjustment for
BETH](/en-eu/help/okx-to-adjust-discount-rates-for-beth-2024-02-06) originally
scheduled at 6:00-8:00 am UTC on February 9, 2024 has been postponed. The new
adjustment time will be **6:00-8:00 am UTC on February 12, 2024.**  
Specific adjustments are as follows:

Asset | Before | After  
---|---|---  
Tier (USD) | Discount rate | Tier (USD) | Discount rate  
BETH | 0 ~ 2,000,000 | 0.95 | 0 ~ 1,000,000 | 0.8  
2,000,000 ~ 4,000,000 | 0.85 | 1,000,000 ~ 2,000,000 | 0.75  
4,000,000 ~ 8,000,000 | 0.5 | 2,000,000 ~ 4,000,000 | 0.5  
> 8,000,000 | 0 | > 4,000,000 | 0  
  
For original announcement, please check: [OKX to adjust discount rates for
BETH](/en-eu/help/okx-to-adjust-discount-rates-for-beth-2024-02-06)

**Introduction to discount rates**  
In multi-currency cross margin mode and portfolio margin mode, different
currencies in cross margin accounts can be converted into their USD value and
used as margin. Due to significant differences in market liquidity of each
currency, the platform calculates their actual USD value based on a certain
discount rate in order to balance market risks.  
Learn more: [Discount rate](/en-eu/trade-market/discountrate)

title: OKX to adjust discount rates for BETH
body:
OKX will adjust the discount rates for BETH in the multi-currency margin mode
and portfolio margin mode. The adjustment will take place at **6:00 am – 8:00
am (UTC) on February 9, 2024.**  
Specific adjustments are as follows:

Asset | Before | After  
---|---|---  
Tier (USD) | Discount rate | Tier (USD) | Discount rate  
BETH | 0 ~ 2,000,000 | 0.95 | 0 ~ 1,000,000 | 0.8  
2,000,000 ~ 4,000,000 | 0.85 | 1,000,000 ~ 2,000,000 | 0.75  
4,000,000 ~ 8,000,000 | 0.5 | 2,000,000 ~ 4,000,000 | 0.5  
> 8,000,000 | 0 | > 4,000,000 | 0  
  
**Introduction to discount rates**  
In multi-currency cross margin mode and portfolio margin mode, different
currencies in cross margin accounts can be converted into their USD value and
used as margin. Due to significant differences in market liquidity of each
currency, the platform calculates their actual USD value based on a certain
discount rate in order to balance market risks.  
Learn more: [Discount rate](/en-eu/trade-market/discountrate)

Risk warning: The foregoing overview and information, some of which may be
provided by third parties and not OKX, are for informational and educational

**Index Price Computation**

The index price is calculated by weighting the prices of components based on
their respective weights. For more details, please refer to [Spot index
prices](/en-eu/help/i-spot-index-prices).

  
 **Component adjustments can cause an index’s mark price to fluctuate,
affecting the corresponding instrument’s margin and contract trading
markets.**

 **Users are advised to take necessary measures before an adjustment, such as
reducing positions, adding margin, lowering leverage or even closing positions
to avoid potential risks introduced by market volatility.**

**Index Price Computation**

The index price is calculated by weighting the prices of components based on
their respective weights. For more details, please refer to [Spot index
prices](/en-eu/help/i-spot-index-prices).

 **Component adjustments can cause an index’s mark price to fluctuate,
affecting the corresponding instrument’s margin and contract trading
markets.**

 **Users are advised to take necessary measures before an adjustment, such as
reducing positions, adding margin, lowering leverage or even closing positions
to avoid potential risks introduced by market volatility.**

title: Further Update Regarding OKB Price Volatility
body:
As of 11:00 am UTC on January 26, 2024, we are adjusting the mark price we are
using to calculate account adjustments in reference to the OKB price
volatility issue from 48.36 USDT to 52.73 USDT. Funds will automatically be
deposited into user accounts.

  
For any inquiries regarding the adjustments or eligibility, please contact us
via the [_Support Center_](/en-eu/help).

  
Kind regards,

OKX Team

title: Update Regarding OKB Price Volatility
body:
This week, between 9:07 and 9:09 am UTC on January 23, 2024, OKB spot trading
pairs experienced abnormal price volatility on our platform. This incident
started when a substantially leveraged spot position was liquidated, which led
to a domino effect liquidating multiple positions within flexible loan,
margined spot trading, and multi-currency margin trading products. Some of our
customers who had open trades or were part of the force liquidation were
impacted.

As we advised [here](/en-eu/help/okx-to-adjust-discount-rates-for-several-
assets-2024-01-24), OKX has adjusted its relevant risk parameters and we will
adjust the accounts of eligible users that were impacted.

Some of the eligible cases for account adjustment may include:

  * Margined spot positions long OKB
  * Flexible Loan with OKB as a collateral
  * Cross positions with OKB margined under multi-currency margin accounts

We will automatically deposit funds into eligible users' funding accounts in
USDT before February 1, 2024.

**Adjustment rules and calculation parameters**

Account adjustment for eligible users (to be determined at OKX's sole
discretion) will cover the price difference loss, as calculated by OKX, that
resulted from forced selling of OKB at a lower price during a liquidation and
any liquidation penalties and transaction fees associated with the
liquidation. For loans and positions with multiple collateral that included
OKB, liquidation penalties and trading fees that were charged for the sale of
the other collateral or positions will also be reimbursed, subject to OKX's
discretion. Bankruptcy losses covered by the insurance fund will be excluded.

**A price difference loss** refers to a loss caused by the difference between
the mark price at 9:07:26am UTC (48.36 USDT) and the resulting liquidation
prices during the period.

For example: If 10 OKB was liquidated at a liquidation price of 40.0 USDT, OKX
will compensate difference of (48.36 - 40.0) * 10 = 83.6 USDT. Compensation
will also include the associated liquidation penalty and trading fees (as
determined by OKX), and exclude any bankruptcy losses already covered by the
insurance fund.

For any additional inquiries regarding adjustment or eligibility, please
contact us via the [Support Center](/en-eu/help).

Kind regards,

OKX Team

**Note: Not all users who held positions during the volatility period will be
compensated, only users who are determined to be eligible based on the above
outlined criteria will be compensated.

title: Update on OKB volatility
body:
At 09:07 am UTC on 23 January 2024 the price of OKB dropped from 50.69 to
48.36 USDT, causing several margined positions to automatically liquidate. As
a result, OKB experienced high volatility for about three minutes, reaching a
low of 25.1 USDT before the market stabilized.

We understand this situation is unusual and apologize to impacted users.
Compensation will be provided to users who experienced losses as a result of
abnormal liquidations, including users of flexible loan, margin trading and
multicurrency trading products. A detailed compensation plan will be released
in 72 hours.

In addition, we will work to continuously improve OKX's margin position tier
rules, risk management controls, and liquidation mechanism to avoid any future
abnormal liquidations.

Regards,  
OKX team  
23 January 2024 (UTC)

The index price is calculated by weighting the prices of components based on
their respective weights. For more details, please refer to [Spot index
prices](/en-eu/help/i-spot-index-prices).

  
**Component adjustments can cause an index’s mark price to fluctuate,
affecting the corresponding instrument’s margin and contract trading markets.  
Users are advised to take necessary measures before an adjustment, such as
reducing positions, adding margin, lowering leverage or even closing positions
to avoid potential risks introduced by market volatility.**

title: OKX to change funding fee collection mechanism for remaining group of perpetual futures
body:
To provide you with better services, OKX will gradually change the funding fee
collection mechanism for the remaining group of perpetual futures from cross-
period collection to current-period collection. Perpetual futures that have
already changed to the current-period collection mechanism are listed in the
following announcement: [https://www.okx.com/help/okx-to-change-funding-fee-
collection-mechanism](/en-eu/help/okx-to-change-funding-fee-collection-
mechanism)

 **Before the change:  
** Formerly, funding fee calculations were based on the funding rate of the
previous funding period (cross-period collection). For example, when the
funding fee is collected every 8 hours, funding fee calculations at 8:00 am
UTC today use the funding rate determined by the premium index from 4:00 pm
UTC yesterday to 12:00 am UTC today, resulting in a fixed value from 12:00 am
UTC to 8:00 am UTC.  
  
 **After the change:  
** Funding fee calculations will be based on the funding rate of the current
funding period (current-period collection).For example, funding fee
calculations at 8:00 am UTC every day will use the funding rate determined by
the premium index from 12:00 am UTC to 8:00 am UTC. Note that the funding rate
may fluctuate before the funding fee is collected, so you need to dynamically
manage your positions according to current conditions.

title: OKX to adjust the minimum order quantities for several futures
body:
To continually improve the trading experience and reduce costs for our
traders, OKX will adjust ‌the minimum order quantities for some perpetual and
expiry futures. This update is scheduled for **6:00 am - 10:00 am UTC on March
14, 2024.** Corresponding adjustments to ‌step size will also be implemented.  
The specific adjustments are as follows:

Instrument | Trading pair | Minimum order quantity, step size (contracts)
(Before) | Minimum order quantity, step size (contracts) (After)  
---|---|---|---  
Expiry | LTCUSDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | LTCUSDT | 1 | 0.1  
Perpetual | SHIBUSDT | 1 | 0.1  
  
For more information, please visit the OKX website: [Trading rules](/en-
eu/trade-market/info/swap)  
  
Please note: All trading activities, including order placement, fund
transfers, and leverage adjustments, will remain unaffected during the
adjustment period for step size and minimum order quantity.

  
**1\. Understanding step size and minimum order quantity**  
Step size is defined as the smallest possible increment or decrement in the
number of contracts placed for perpetual and expiry futures.  
For instance, in the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract size of 0.1
ETH, the updated step size is set at 0.1 contracts. This means the minimum
fluctuation in the contracts ordered is 0.1 contracts (equivalent to 0.01
ETH).

Minimum order quantity is the smallest number of contracts permissible for an
order in perpetual and expiry futures. It must be an integer multiple of the
step size. Traders must place orders equal to or larger than this minimum
order quantity.  
For instance, in the ETHUSDT perpetual futures with a contract size of 0.1 ETH
and a step size of 0.1 contracts, the minimum order quantity is set at 1
contract (0.1 ETH). This implies that order quantities must be greater than or
equal to 1 contract (0.1 ETH), but can be increased in increments based on
‌step size, such as 1.1 contracts, 1.2 contracts, and so on.

  
**2\. Display rules for open positions and open orders**  
Upon adjusting the step size, if the new step size is less than 1, both
position contract sizes and order quantities will be displayed in decimals.
This applies to unfulfilled, partially filled, completely filled, and open
orders, as well as the sizes of open positions.  
For instance, the SHIBUSDT perpetual futures has a contract size of 1,000,000
SHIB. Currently, the step size is set at 1 contract, order quantity of 10
contracts (10,000,000 SHIB) and a position size of 1 contract (1,000,000
SHIB). After adjusting the step size to 0.1 contracts, the order quantity will
be displayed as 10.5 contracts (10,500,000 SHIB) and the position size as 1.5
contracts (1,500,000 SHIB).  
(This adjustment is applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)

  
**3\. Order processing rules**  
For new orders, traders must ensure that the quantity placed or modified is an
integral multiple of the step size and at least equal to the minimum order
quantity.  
Take the SHIBUSDT perpetual contract as an example: with a contract size of
1,000,000 SHIB, both the current step size and the minimum order quantity are
set at 1 contract. This means that when placing or modifying orders, the
quantities must be in integral multiples of 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB), with
the smallest permissible order being 1 contract (1,000,000 SHIB).  
When the step size is adjusted to 0.1 contracts, any order placed or modified
must be in integral multiples of 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB); and after
adjusting the minimum order quantity to 0.1 contracts, the order size must be
greater than or equal to 0.1 contracts (100,000 SHIB).  
(These rules are also applicable to API users, bot traders, and copy traders.)

  
**4\. API interface adjustment rules**  
Post-adjustment, the API endpoint (/api/v5/public/instruments) and the
WebSocket channel (Instruments) will reflect the updated values for step size
(lotSz) and minimum order quantity (minSz).  
More details: [https://www.okx.com/docs-v5/log_en/#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts](/docs-v5/log_en#upcoming-changes-lot-size-
change-for-futures-contracts)

title: OKX to adjust discount rates for several assets
body:
OKX will adjust the discount rates for several assets in the multi-currency
margin mode and portfolio margin mode. The adjustment will take place at
**6:00 am – 8:00 am (UTC) on January 15, 2024.**  
Specific adjustments are as follows:

Assets | Before | After  
---|---|---  
Tiers (USD) | Discount rates | Tiers (USD) | Discount rates  
SUI | 0~250,000 | 0.8 | 0~1,000,000 | 0.85  
250,000~500,000 | 0.7 | 1,000,000~2,000,000 | 0.75  
500,000~1,000,000 | 0.5 | 2,000,000~4,000,000 | 0.5  
>1,000,000 | 0 | >4,000,000 | 0  
PEOPLE, LUNC, TRB, SATS | 0~50,000 | 0.5 | 0~250,000 | 0.8  
>50,000 | 0 | 250,000~500,000 | 0.7  
500,000~1,000,000 | 0.5  
>1,000,000 | 0  
  
**Introduction to discount rates**  
In multi-currency cross margin mode and portfolio margin mode, different
currencies in cross margin accounts can be converted into their USD value and
used as margin. Due to significant differences in market liquidity of each
currency, the platform calculates their actual USD value based on a certain
discount rate in order to balance market risks.  
Learn more: [Discount rate](/en-eu/trade-market/discountrate)

**Index Price Computation**  
The index price is calculated by weighting the prices of components based on
their respective weights. For more details, please refer to [Spot index
prices](/en-eu/help/i-spot-index-prices).

  
**Component adjustments can cause an index’s mark price to fluctuate,
affecting the corresponding instrument’s margin and contract trading markets.  
Users are advised to take necessary measures before an adjustment, such as
reducing positions, adding margin, lowering leverage or even closing positions
to avoid potential risks introduced by market volatility.**

  
Risk warning: The foregoing overview and information, some of which may be
provided by third parties and not OKX, are for informational and educational
purposes only. OKX does not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of any
information contained herein and such information does not constitute any
representation, warranty nor any financial, investment or other form of advice
by OKX. Such information may not be suitable for all persons; it should not be
relied upon in connection with a particular investor's trading; and, is not
intended to be, nor should be construed as, an offer, recommendation or
solicitation. Such information is also not intended for persons who reside in
jurisdictions where providing such information would violate the laws or
regulations of such jurisdiction. Digital assets are highly speculative and
subject to high volatility, may become illiquid at any time, and that
investors may lose the entire value of their investment. Before trading any
digital asset, you should do your own research and evaluate your risk
appetite. OKX is not responsible for any losses which you may incur from
trading digital assets. Please refer to [Terms of Service](/en-eu/help/terms-
of-service) and [Risk & Compliance Disclosure](/en-eu/help/risk-compliance-
disclosure) for more information.

  
For any inquiries regarding this adjustment, please feel free to contact us
via the [OKX Telegram](https://t.me/OKXOfficial_English) group or the [Support
Center](/en-eu/help).

  
OKX team  
January 12, 2024

title: OKX to adjust weightings of components for several indexes
body:
To improve market liquidity and index stability, OKX will adjust the
components and their weights of several indexes at **8:00 am - 10:00 am UTC on
January 11, 2024.** The adjusted index prices will be calculated by weighting
the prices of the new components according to their updated weights.

title: OKX to support OP, MANTA, BASE, MODE, WORLD, and LISK networks’ mainnet upgrade
body:
We’ll be supporting the Optimism (OP), MANTA, BASE, MODE, WORLD, and LISK
networks' mainnet upgrade and Hard Fork.

  * We’ll suspend deposits and withdrawals of OP, MANTA, BASE, MODE, WORLD, and LISK tokens, as well as tokens belonging to these networks at 4:00 pm UTC on January 9, 2025.

  * The services will resume once the upgraded networks are stable without further announcement.

  * If you hold any OP, MANTA, BASE, MODE, WORLD and LISK tokens, or tokens belonging to these networks in your account, you don’t need to do anything during the upgrade period.

  
Please note:

  * Trading of OP, MANTA, BASE, MODE, WORLD and LISK tokens, or tokens belonging to these networks will be available as usual. Please be aware of the risks associated with the spot, margin, and derivatives trading of these tokens, and make sure you increase your margin to lower your risk.

  * For the safety of your funds, please **don’t** make any further deposits or withdrawals of OP, MANTA, BASE, MODE, WORLD and LISK tokens, as well as tokens belonging to the network during the period.

  
For more details on the network upgrade, please visit:

  * [ _Optimism Network Upgrade_](https://gov.optimism.io/t/upgrade-proposal-11-holocene-network-upgrade/9313)

  
OKX team

January 8, 2025

title: OKX to support PHA crypto migration
body:
According to the official plan of Phala Network, OKX will support the PHA
(Khala) crypto migration as per the following schedule:

  1. PHA (Khala) deposits and withdrawals will be suspended at **6:00 am UTC on January 8, 2025**.

  2. The subsequent crypto migration will take place between **6:00 am UTC on January 8, 2025, and 6:00 am UTC on January 11, 2025.** While OKX will strive to complete the migration within the specified time frame, there may be delays in the process due to the need for coordination with the project team and other parties.

  3. PHA trading will not be affected.

  
After the migration is completed, OKX will restore the deposits and
withdrawals for the PHA (ERC20), but we will no longer support deposits of the
PHA (Khala). Only deposits of the PHA (ERC20) will be supported. Please pay
attention when depositing to avoid any losses.

title: OKX introduces 30-day verification for withdrawal address book
body:
OKX is launching a new feature on July 4, 2024, 7:00 am UTC, which gives users
the choice to verify addresses in their withdrawal address book for **30
days** or **permanently**.

### How does this new feature work?

When an address is verified for 30 days, withdrawals have to be made within 30
days to maintain its verified status. If no withdrawal is made, its
verification will expire and future withdrawals to this address will require
security verification.If a withdrawal is made, the expiry date will be
extended to 30 days after the latest withdrawal date. For example, if you make
a transaction at 7:00 am UTC July 4, 2024, the verification period will be
extended to 7:00 am UTC August 3, 2024.  

### How does this impact existing verified addresses?

Starting from 7:00 am UTC on July 4, 2024, **all existing verified addresses**
in the OKX withdrawal address book will be placed on **a 30-day expiry
period.** Please review these addresses and if you wish to verify them
permanently, try one of the following two methods:

  1. Wait until the 30-day verification expires and verify the addresses again permanently.

  2. Delete the addresses and add them again as permanently verified addresses.

### How to verify addresses for 30 days?

When you choose to verify an address in the withdrawal address book, it will
be verified for **30 days** by default. Select "Change verification period" to
verify the address **permanently**. This feature will be available in both web
and app (version 6.75 and newer).  

OKX team

body:
**OKX will launch exclusive SOLV Airdrop on 21st Jan, user could stake BTC for
SOLV token.**

##  **About SOLV Airdrop**

 **Rules**

  * Complete identity verification.

  * Stake at least 0.0001 BTC to be eligible to receive airdrop rewards.

  * During the campaign period, we’ll take daily snapshot of your total BTC subscriptions. This snapshot will determine your total rewards.

 **Rewards distribution**

  * Your assets will be securely kept in OKX on-chain wallet. 

  * Your airdrop rewards will be distributed to your funding account every day.

  * Your rewards are currently not tradable, hence, you could withdraw your assets to OKX Web3 to trade. 

## **About SOLV Protocol**

Solv Protocol is a Bitcoin staking platform that abstracts the complexities of
Bitcoin staking through the Staking Abstraction Layer (SAL). At the same time,
it provides a universal Bitcoin reserve token (SolvBTC) that can be used on
multiple chains. Solv provides retail and institutional investors with
diversified income opportunities while seamlessly integrating Bitcoin into the
DeFi ecosystem and ensuring the liquidity of assets.

title: OKX to upgrade Dual Investment settlement experience
body:
Dear OKX Users,

To enhance your trading experience and provide greater flexibility, OKX will
adjust the Dual Investment settlement time from 18:00 UTC+8 to 16:30 UTC+8.
This upgrade is now scheduled to take effect on April 15, 2025.

Key Details:

  * Settlement Time Adjustment: Users will receive settlement proceeds 90 minutes earlier than previous arrangements.

  * System Upgrade Window: The upgrade will occur between 10:00 UTC+8 and 10:30 UTC+8 on April 15, 2025. During this period, Dual Investment services may be temporarily unavailable.

  * Order Updates: All active Dual Investment orders, including those created prior to April 15, 2025, will automatically adopt the new settlement time of 16:30 UTC+8 after the upgrade.

We apologize for any inconvenience during the maintenance window and
appreciate your patience as we work to improve your experience.

Thank you for your continued trust in OKX.

OKX Team  
April 9, 2025

title: Exclusive OKSOL campaigns to earn extra rewards
body:
OKX is launching a series of exclusive **OKSOL** campaigns – **OKSOL** Learn &
Earn and **OKSOL** APR (Average Percentage Rewards) Boosting – on December 19,
2024. You can earn rewards by learning about OKSOL and completing designated
tasks. Additionally, you can participate in APR (Average Percentage Rewards)
Boosting to receive extra staking rewards.

##  **About OKSOL Learn & Earn**

###  **Campaign rules**

  * Complete all 3 required tasks within the campaign period to be eligible to receive rewards on a first-come, first-served basis

    * Learn about **OKSOL** : Read 5 short introductions about **OKSOL** and the related On-chain Earn Product. You can revisit the learning materials during the **Learn & Earn Campaign Period.**

    * Take a quiz: Answer 5 questions to test your **OKSOL** knowledge based on the introductions.

    * Obtain **OKSOL** : Stake at least 0.01 SOL on On-chain Earn or buy OKSOL from spot market.

    * Users can only participate through the OKX app.

###  **Campaign details**

 **Campaign period**

|

 **Prize pool**

|

 **Rewards amount**  
  
---|---|---  
  
December 19, 2024 ~ January 19, 2025

|

 **180 OKSOL**

|

 **0.0075 OKSOL**  
  
###  **Rewards distribution**

  * Rewards are limited and are based on a first-come, first-served basis.

  * Rewards are only allocated to the first 24,000 eligible users, which will be distributed after the campaign ends.

  * If you’re one of the first 24,000 eligible users, you will receive **0.0075 OKSOL**. Distribution will take place 7 business days after the end of the campaign.

##  **About OKSOL APR (Average Percentage Rewards) Boosting Campaign**

###  **Campaign rules**

  * During the **APR (Average Percentage Rewards) Boosting Campaign** , **** you only need to hold an additional **0.01 OKSOL** or more in your OKX account. The newly added amount will qualify for the corresponding APR incentives, enabling you to enjoy extra rewards.

  * Users can participate through the OKX app and website.

###  **Campaign details**

 **Campaign period**

|

 **Prize pool**

|

 **Reward Token**  
  
---|---|---  
  
December 19, 2024 ~ January 06, 2025

|

428 OKSOL

|

OKSOL  
  
###  **Rewards distribution**

  * Your rewards will be distributed daily in the form of OKSOL to your funding account.

The OKSOL APR (Average Percentage Rewards) Boosting program will periodically
launch reward campaigns for OKSOL holders, helping users generate more
earnings. Stay tuned for official announcements for more details!  

 **Note** : The Learn and Earn and APR Boosting campaigns require users to
complete identity verification. Sub-accounts are not eligible to participate
in these campaigns.  

## About OKSOL

OKSOL is a Solana liquid staking token developed by OKX, representing the SOL
staked by users on the OKX platform. By staking SOL, users receive OKSOL at a
1:1 ratio. Holding OKSOL allows users to enjoy both native staking rewards and
MEV rewards while maintaining asset liquidity. OKSOL can be used for
collateral or trading, while the original SOL remains staked, providing a
flexible solution for users who wish to participate in staking without losing
liquidity.

  *  **Stability and security** : The design of OKSOL prioritizes the security of user assets, eliminating potential smart contract risks.

  *  **Flexible redemption options** :

    * Standard redemption process: Approximately 4~5 days.

    * Selling through spot trading pair: Real-time.

  *  **Higher capital efficiency** : In collateralized lending, OKSOL serves as an efficient tool to help users optimize capital utilization. In the future, OKSOL will also be integrated into structured products.

## How to obtain OKSOL

There are two ways to obtain OKSOL:

  * Go to the **Grow** page and click on **On-chain Earn** , then select **SOL Staking**.

  * Obtain OKSOL through spot trading pair.

title: OKX to list OKSOL — new Solana liquid staking token
body:
To meet users' needs for both efficient asset utilization and staking rewards,
OKX will launch the SOL liquid staking token **OKSOL** on **December 11,
2024**. Spot trading pairs **OKSOL/SOL** and **OKSOL/USDT** will be available,
and **OKSOL can also be used as collateral**. New campaigns will be coming
soon.

## About OKSOL and advantages

OKSOL is a Solana liquid staking token developed by OKX, representing the SOL
staked by users on OKX. By staking SOL, you'll receive OKSOL at a 1:1 ratio.
Holding OKSOL allows users to enjoy native staking and MEV rewards while
maintaining liquidity. OKSOL can be used as collateral or for trading, while
the original SOL remains staked. This provides a flexible solution for users
who want to participate in staking without losing liquidity.

  *  **Stability and security** : OKSOL is designed with asset security as the top priority. It's used as a Solana liquid staking token on OKX with no potential smart contract risks.

  *  **Flexible redemption options** :

    * Standard redemption: approximately 3-5 days

    * Spot trading: real-time

    * OKX will also introduce a fast redemption feature for OKSOL in the future

  *  **Maximize capital efficiency** : In lending and collateral scenarios, OKSOL serves as an efficient tool to help you optimize capital utilization. OKSOL will also be launched in structured products in the future.

## How to get OKSOL?

There are 2 ways to get OKSOL:

  * Go to **Grow > On-chain Earn**, then choose **SOL Staking**.

  * Get OKSOL through spot trading.

## About the OKSOL spot trading pairs

 **Launch time**

  *  **OKSOL/USDT** :

    * [ _ **Call auction**_](/en-eu/help/call-auction-mechanism) will take place from 7:00 am to 8:00 am UTC on December 11, 2024.

    * Spot trading will open at 8:00 am UTC on December 11, 2024.

  *  **OKSOL/SOL** :

    * [ _ **Call auction**_](/en-eu/help/call-auction-mechanism) will take place from 7:30 am to 8:30 am UTC on December 11, 2024.

    * Spot trading will open at 8:30 am UTC on December 11, 2024.

  
 **Rules for** **spot trading opening**

In order to protect users from price volatility at the opening of spot
trading, OKX will impose the following restrictions on orders during the first
5 minutes of trading:

  1. No market orders allowed.

  2. Each limit order must not exceed 10,000 USD in value.

These restrictions will be lifted after the first 5 minutes of trading.

  
 **About Call Auctions**

Call auction mechanism will be used for spot listing of OKSOL/USDT and
OKSOL/SOL. The call auction period will last for 1 hour.

OKX operates a call auction mechanism that allows you to submit buy and sell
orders at your desired prices according to certain trading parameters before a
new trading pair officially begins trading. The trading system processes all
submissions according to call auction rules and calculates an indicative
opening price based on these submissions.

In order to provide more trading information, following the end of the call
auction, OKX will display the project team's opening price at the commencement
of continuous trading as the initial price of the trading chart. The project
team's opening price is provided by the token project team usually based on
the valuation of the project. This project team's opening price is displayed
for information purpose only, and is not determined by the call auction
mechanism, and will not impact the prices where you will execute the orders.  

### About OKSOL as collateral

OKSOL will be eligible as collateral starting at 9:30 am UTC on December 11,
2024. Your OKSOL in cross margin positions of the multi-currency margin mode
and portfolio margin mode can be used as margin based on their USD value, as
calculated by crypto's discount rate.

Please refer to this link for the discount rate design after launch:
[https://www.okx.com/zh-hans/trade-market/discountrate](/en-eu/trade-
market/discountrate)

### About OKX Staked SOL (OKSOL)

OKX Staked SOL (OKSOL) will go live on December 11, 2024. You can stake SOL
and receive the liquid staking token OKSOL at a 1 to 1 reserve ratio. This
allows you to earn SOL staking rewards while unlocking liquidity.

### About OKSOL earn campaign

OKX will soon launch OKSOL-related incentive campaigns, aiming to provide
users with a better earning experience.

Details of the campaign will be announced separately. Stay tuned!

  
 **Disclaimer**

This product could result in a complete loss of your digital assets. No
investment advice is provided. Not an offer to purchase, sell, or hold digital
assets. Historical returns do not guarantee actual performance. By accessing a
third party staking or DeFi protocol (the "Protocol"), your use of and any
information or assets you provide to the Protocol will also be governed by
their terms. OKX is not associated with the Protocol, makes no warranties or
representations of their offerings, and is not responsible for any loss
arising from your use of the same.

  
OKX team

December 11, 2024
